document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

subSubSection.paragraph:
38.
Theognete scopulus Anderson
, new species
( Figures 152 , 187 , 222 )

Diagnosis. Size. Length, male, 3.23–3.82mm ; female, 2.98–4.05mm . Width, male, 1.97–2.14mm ; female, 1.69–2.25mm . As for
T. montana
but elytra rounded, much less elongate; scales of pronotum and elytral intervals plumose, arched apically; scales of strial regions longer, suberect and arched, giving dorsum a much more shaggy appearance. Abdominal ventrite 5 not impressed in either sex. Aedeagus as in Fig. 187 .
Natural history . Collected from berlese extraction of cloud forest and wet oak forest leaf litter at elevations of from 2650–2910m .

Derivation of specific name . Noun in apposition; from the Latin
scopulus
, meaning a projecting point of rock, in reference to the occurrence of this species at the top of Cerro Huitepec.

Material examined .
280♂ , 210♀♀ ( BMNH , CMNC , CNCI , CWOB , ECOS , USNM , UVGC )
.

Chorological relationships . Sympatric with
T. montana
,
T. huitepec
,
T. maziaki , T. cortesi , T. barringerorum , T. evelynae
and
T. campbelli
.
